channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Best Kindle of 2025: Paperwhite, Scribe, or Colorsoft?
item.description: Here’s how Amazon’s ebook readers stack up—and which one might be right for you.

item.title: The Best Motorola Phones (2025), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Motorola phones may seem old-school, but their reasonable prices, colorful designs, and simple software make them good, wallet-friendly Android smartp...

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
item.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2025.

item.title: Google Data Centers Are Returning Nuclear Power to Tornado Country
item.description: A destructive storm in 2020 prematurely shut down Iowa’s only nuclear plant. With Google’s plans to reopen it to power nearby data centers, will extre...

item.title: The 24 Best Shows on Amazon Prime, WIRED’s Picks (December 2025)
item.description: Bat-Fam, The Girlfriend, and The Mighty Nein are just a few of the shows you should be watching on Amazon Prime Video this week.

item.title: 18 Gifts for People Who Are Perpetually Cold (2025)
item.description: From a backyard hot tub to the warmest slippers, these picks will make your loved ones feel warm and fuzzy—inside and out.

item.title: OK, what’s going on with LinkedIn’s algo?
item.description: Women ran an experiment to see if LinkedIn's new algo was being sexist and thought they proved it. But there's more complexity involved, experts say.

item.title: Riding onboard with Rivian’s race to autonomy
item.description: Rivian demonstrated the progress it's made, and in the process showed just how far it still has to go to make its cars autonomous.

item.title: Google and Apple roll out emergency security updates after zero-day attacks
item.description: Apple released patches for all of its flagship devices to fix security flaws under attack. Google also updated Chrome to remediate one vulnerability e...

item.title: With iOS 26.2, Apple lets you roll back Liquid Glass again — this time on the Lock Screen
item.description: Your iPhone clock doesn't have to be so "glassy" anymore, thanks to a new Apple software update.
